isis.stitle: Recall 99512 - Quality Connect Check Valves in the Primary and Secondary Air Tanks on 9000i Models Built 06/21/99 through 07/20/99

recall.subject: Quality Connect Check Valves in the Primary and Secondary Air Tanks on 9000i Models Built 06/21/99 through 07/20/99

defect.para: Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard 121 requires the air brake system pressure increase from 85 psi to 100 psi within 27 seconds based on the reservoir capacity for these models. The check valves on these vehicles are defective because they do not comply with FMVSS 121. This noncompliance could potentially affect the vehicle's braking ability and should be corrected in accordance with this letter.

Navistar will notify owners of this campaign on their vehicles. A listing of owner names and addresses has been furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Before performing the service, please read and understand the following instructions completely.

warning.para: To prevent serious eye injury, ALWAYS wear safe eye protection when you perform vehicle maintenance or service.

Block the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving. Support the vehicle with safety stands. Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or fall over resulting in serious personal injury or death.

svcproc.para: Please read the following steps carefully before proceeding.

note.para: This recall applies to the plastic check valves mounted directly in the end of the air tanks and not the threaded brass check valves which are external to the tanks. One of the check valves is located in the rear of the primary air tank, which is the tank closest to the left frame rail. And the second check valve is located in the front of the secondary air tank, which is the tank closest to the right frame rail.

step1.para:
Verify that the vehicle has the defective check valves by using Figure 1 and Figure 2 below. If the vehicle does not have this type of check valve the inspection is over and the repair does not apply to the vehicle.
But, if the vehicle has this check valve continue with the service procedure.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. Step 4.D describes how to use the air line to remove the valve.
2. Step 5.B instructs installer to add non petroleum lube to O-ring.

step1.para: Drain the air tanks by opening the drain valves. Leave drain valves open where possible.
Remove the air lines from the check valves.
Removing the check valves from the air tanks (see Figure 1 and Figure 2).

step2.para: Carefully remove/scrape dirt and paint from the check valve retaining snap ring area.
Carefully remove the snap ring by prying the tapered end of the snap ring inward towards the port center. Only one end of the snap ring has a taper (see Figure 3, Figure 4, and Figure 5 below).
To prevent contaminants from entering the tank, clean all dirt and paint from the snap ring groove area before removing the valve.

To remove the check valve, either, re-install the air line and pull out the valve or use the plug that came with the new valve. When using the plug to aid in valve removal, firmly insert the plug into the valve opening and pry under the top of the plug using the top of the bushing/port for leverage (see Figure 6).
Immediately destroy and discard the defective check valves and snap rings.

step1.para: Installing the new check valves in the air tanks.

step2.para: Wipe out the air tank ports with a clean rag.
Apply some silicone base lube to the O-rings before installing them into the air tanks. Do not use petroleum base lubes (Liquid soap with no grit may also be used).
Install the new check valves into the air tanks.

Install the new snap rings into the tanks, ensuring the snap ring is fully seated. If the snap ring does not seat into the groove, apply gentle pressure to the center of the check valve to make sure it is fully inserted and attempt to seat the snap ring again.

step1.para: Re-install the air lines into the check valves. No unpainted portion of the air line will be exposed when the air line is properly re-inserted. Close all drain ports that were not closed previously.
Start the engine and build air pressure and check for air leaks.

partsinfo.para: Two check valves are required to repair each vehicle in this campaign that is found to have the Quality Connect Check Valves. A vehicle with Quality Connect check valves will need two of part number 3545290C1.

laborinfo.para: A Warranty Claim for this recall may have Labor Operations one or one and two performed to complete the repair. Therefore, the minimum labor time is 0.3 hour and the maximum labor time is 0.5 hour.

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified IMMEDIATELY from your dealer location.
Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired with 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.
However, consistent with the customer notification, dealers are expected to complete the repairs on the mutually agreed upon service date.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner's vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair their vehicle as soon as possible.

claims.para: Refer to Dealer Warranty Manual for procedures to conduct Recall Campaigns.

It is important that the Recall Coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to Items 39 through 44.

responex.para: We ask for your full cooperation and follow-up to this important subject matter. If you have any questions, or need further assistance, please contact the Regional Service Manager at your regional office.
